details.title: Most expensive players in IPL auctions
details.content:
2008 - MS Dhoni ($1.5 million)
2009 - Flintoff/Pietersen ($1.55 m)
2010 - Shane Bond ($0.75 m)
2011 - Gautam Gambhir ($2.4 m)
2012 - Ravindra Jadeja ($2 m)
2013 - Glenn Maxwell ($1 m)
2014 - Yuvraj Singh (14 crores)
2015 - Yuvraj Sing (16 cr)
2016 - Shane Watson (9.5 cr)
2017 - Ben Stokes (14.5 cr)
2018 - Ben Stokes (12.5 cr)
2019 - Jaydev Unadkat/Varun Chakravarthy (8.4 cr)

details.title: Five bowlers who could garner crores in the IPL auction
details.content: The demand for overseas quicks is expected to be high with all six franchises barring Kolkata Knight Riders and Mumbai Indians looking for a seasoned pacer. Check them out here

details.content: There will be bidding wars for these batsmen. Read more here

details.content:

details.content:

details.title: Five foreign all-rounders who can pocket crores
details.content: The T20 format paves the way for those who 'multi-task' to be more in demand and it won't be different today. Read more here

details.title: Auctioneer
details.content: International auctioneer Hugh Edmeades will be conducting the auction this year

details.title: Welcome to the IPL 2020 Auction
details.content: Brijesh Patel, chairman of the IPL governing council, welcomes the franchises for the IPL 2020 auction

details.title: Chris Lynn- base value Rs 2 crore
details.content: Chris Lynn is the first player to be auctioned today

details.title: Lynn to MI
details.content: Chris Lynn sold to Mumbai Indians for Rs 2 crore. No other team bid for him.

details.title: Bidding war has begun for Eoin Morgan
details.content: Delhi Capitals and KKR are in a bidding war for Eoin Morgan and he is sold to KKR for Rs 5.25 crores to KKR. His base price was Rs 1.5 crore.

details.title: Robin Uthappa under the hammer
details.content: Robin Uthappa is sold to Rajasthan Royals to Rs 3 crore. His base price was Rs 1.5 crore

details.title: Unsold!
details.content: Hanuma Vihari remains unsold with a base price of Rs 50 lakh.

details.title: Pujara unsold
details.content: Indian batsman Cheteshwar Pujara remains unsold with a base price of Rs 50 lakh.

details.title: Delhi Capitals get Jason Roy
details.content: England opener Jason Roy is sold to Delhi Capitals at the base price of Rs 1.5 crore.

details.title: Bidding for Aaron Finch
details.content: KKR and RCB bid for the Aussie T20 skipper. Base price - Rs 1 crore

details.title: RCB buy Aaron Finch
details.content: Aaron Finch is sold to RCB for Rs 4.4 crore after a bidding fight with KKR ends. Finch will join Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers in the team.

details.title: Most expensive buy of the afternoon
details.content: With a base price of Rs 2 crore, Glenn Maxwell is sold to Kings XI Punjab for Rs 10.75 crore after a bidding contest with Delhi Capitals.

details.title: DC get Woakes
details.content: English all-rounder Chris Woakes sold to Delhi Capitals for the base price of Rs 1.5 crore.

details.title: Yusuf Pathan unsold!
details.content: Yusuf Pathan remains unsold with a base price of Rs 1 crore.

details.title: Colin de Grandhomme unsold!
details.content: Kiwi all-rounder Colin de Grandhomme remains unsold with a base price of Rs 75 lakh.

details.title: Pat Cummins overtakes Glenn Maxwell
details.content: Aussie pacer Pat Cummins to get richer by Rs 15.5 crore as KKR buy him after competing with RCB and Delhi Capitals.

details.title: CSK want Sam Curran
details.content: Chennai Super Kings bid for Sam Curran and are locking horns with Delhi Capitals. His base value is Rs 1 crore

details.title: CSK get Sam Curran
details.content: Sam Curran is sold to CSK for Rs 5.5 crore.

details.title: Pat Cummins makes HISTORY!
details.content: Pat Cummins has now become the most expensive foreign player in IPL history.

details.title: Intense battleground
details.content: Chris Morris is under the hammer and teams are locked in an intense battle for the Proteas all-rounder. Base price- Rs 1.5 crore

details.title: Chris Morris garners Rs 10 crore
details.content: RCB get the all-rounder for Rs 10 crore after an intense bidding.

details.title: Stuart Binny unsold!
details.content: Former RR and India all-rounder Stuart Binny remains unsold with a base value of Rs 50 lakhs.

details.content:
LION ALERT!
Sweet Saapuda Porom with @CurranSM! #SuperFam #SuperAuction #WhistlePodu pic.twitter.com/Vd0oYWqmgk

details.content:

details.title: Purse remaining
details.content: Kings XI Punjab: Rs 31.95 crore, Kolkata Knight Riders: Rs 14.90 crore, Delhi Capitals: Rs 24.85 crore, Mumbai Indians: Rs 11.05 crore, Royal Challengers Bangalore: Rs 13.50 crore, Rajasthan Royals: Rs 25.90 crore, Sunrisers Hyderabad: Rs 17 crore, Chennai Super Kings: Rs 9.10 crore

.@KKRiders say HI to @patcummins30 @Vivo_India #IPLAuction pic.twitter.com/23jEGFaHKc

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) December 19, 2019

.@Gmaxi_32 is heading to @lionsdenkxip this season. That was some bid by KXIP @Vivo_India #IPLAuction pic.twitter.com/xKCV8LNTWL

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) December 19, 2019

A good deal by @RCBTweets for all-rounder @Tipo_Morris you reckon? @Vivo_India #IPLAuction pic.twitter.com/o3eG8RyZCt

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) December 19, 2019

details.title: Second session begins
details.content: Aussie wicketkeeper Alex Carey is the first one to go under the hammer in the second session. Base price- Rs 50 lakh

details.title: Sold to DC for Rs Rs 2.4 crore
details.content: Alex Carey will make his IPL debut in Delhi Capitals' colours.

details.title: Heinrich Klaasen unsold
details.content: Proteas wicketkeeper batsman Klaasen did not attract any bids and remained unsold.

details.title: Mushfiqur Rahim unsold
details.content: Mushfiqur Rahim remains unsold with a base price of Rs 75 lakh.

details.title: Naman Ojha and Kusal Perera unsold
details.content: Naman Ojha and Kusal Perera remain unsold at a base price of Rs 50 lakh.

details.title: Streak of unsold!
details.content: West Indies wicketkeeper batsman Shai Hope remains unsold even after his impressive performance in the first two ODIs against India.

details.title: Maxwell is a big money player!
details.content:
Glenn Maxwell always goes big at IPL auctions:

2013- $1 million by MI

2014- Rs 6 crore by KXIP

2018- Rs 9 crore by DC

2020- Rs 10.75 crore by KXIP

details.title: RR get Unadkat again!
details.content: Last two IPL auction's most expensive player, Jaydev Unadkat, is bought by his former team Rajasthan Royals for Rs 3 crore.

details.title: No takers for these bowlers.
details.content: Dale Steyn, Andrew Tye, Mohit Sharma remain unsold.

details.title: Aussies pocket big today!
details.content: Another Aussie paceman Nathan Coulter-Nile is bought by Mumbai Indians for Rs 8 crore after a bidding face-off with CSK.

Kiwi fast bowler Tim Southee is unsold #IPLAuction

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) December 19, 2019

details.title: Sheldon Cottrell with base value of Rs 50 lakh
details.content:
VOILA! Sheldon Cottrell will play for @lionsdenkxip. He is SOLD for 8.5 Cr #IPLAuction

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) December 19, 2019

details.title: CSK buy Piyush Chawla
details.content: WIth a base price of Rs 1 crore, Piyush Chawla bags Rs 6.75 crore after a face-off between CSK, MI and KXIP.

details.title: Ish Sodhi, Hayden Walsh and Adam Zampa remain unsold.
details.content:
Spinner @ish_sodhi is unsold #IPLAuction

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) December 19, 2019

Hayden Walsh is unsold - His base price was 50L #IPLAuction

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) December 19, 2019

details.title: Welcome back ladies and gentleman!
details.content: We are back for another set of players going under the hammer.

details.title: Rahul Tripathi sold to KKR
details.content:
Rahul Tripathi is up next and he is sold to @KKRiders for 60L #IPLAuction

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) December 19, 2019

details.title: Virat Singh to SRH
details.content: Jharkhand's Virat Singh is sold to SRH for Rs 1.9 crore.

details.title: India U-19 skipper sold!
details.content: Priyam Garg bags Rs 1.9 crore and is bought by SRH.  His base price was Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: Varun pockets Rs 4 crore!
details.content: Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy is sold to KKR for Rs 4 crore after a bidding face-off with RCB. His base value was  Rs 30 lakhs.

details.title: 17-year-old gets Rs 2.4 crore
details.content: Mumbai's Yashasvi Jaiswal is bought by Rajasthan Royals for Rs 2.4 crore. His base value was Rs 20 lakh.

Daniel Sams is unsold #IPLAuction

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) December 19, 2019

details.title: Shahrukh Khan remains unsold
details.content: Tamil Nadu opener Shahrukh Khan could not attract any buyers.

details.title: Anuj Rawat bags Rs 80 lakh
details.content: Delhi and India U-19 player Anuj Rawat is bought by RR for Rs 80 lakh.

details.title: KS Bharat unsold!
details.content: Andhra's KS Bharat, who was called up in India's Test squad, goes unsold.

details.title: RR getting the young guns.
details.content:
Uncapped fast bowler Akash Singh sold to @rajasthanroyals for 20L #IPLAuction

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) December 19, 2019

details.title: RR at it again.
details.content: UP's Kartik Tyagi is sold for Rs 1.3 crore to Rajasthan Royals.

details.title: Ishan Porel to KXIP
details.content: Bengal's Ishan porel is sold at his base price of Rs 20 lakh to KXIP.

details.title: M Siddhart to KKR
details.content: M Siddhart is sold to KKR for his base price of Rs 20 lakh.

details.title: 19-year-old goes for Rs 2 crore!
details.content: Rajasthan's Ravi Bishnoi is sold to KXIP for Rs 2 crore.

details.title: 14-year-old Noor Ahmad goes unsold
details.content: Afghanistan's Noor Ahmad has no bidders at IPL 2020 auction.

details.title: Highest wicket taker in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy remains unsold
details.content: Said Kishore who bagged 20 wickets in Syed Mushtaq Ali trophy could not attract any buyers.

details.title: Hetmyer pockets Rs 7.75 crore
details.content: After a bidding war, Windies batsman Shimron Hetmyer is sold to DC for Rs 7.75 crore. His base price was Rs 50 lakh.

details.title: Evin Lewis goes unsold
details.content: Evin Lewis found no buyers at IPL 2020 auction.

details.content: Kiwi batting veteran Martin Guptill did not get any bids at a base price of Rs 1 crore.

details.title: KL Rahul named KXIP skipper for IPL 2020
details.content: Rahul's ascendancy to captaincy was expected after Ravichandran Ashwin was traded to Delhi Capitals last month.

details.title: Dinesh Karthik will lead KKR in IPL 2020
details.content: Dinesh Karthik will remain the captain of Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) despite the franchise going for England's World Cup winning captain Eoin Morgan
